result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yesenia Chavez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yesenia Chavez in court.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Yesenia Chavez.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:44 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status. Record by Atty. who has discovery, and will be hiring investigator. Requests status about 90 days out for status. Court sets as requested.
Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

Order for Income Withholding Amended

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Yesenia Chavez in court.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Yesenia Chavez. Victim also present in court. Attorney Spear motioned the court to modify bond, argument presented. State objects to bond modification. Court denies motion, bond remains. Defendant is given a copy of the criminal complaint, reading waived, charges and penalties explained. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Speedy trial rights reserved by defendant. State indicates the information will mirror the criminal complaint. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Motion to Modify Bond
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Order for Income Withholding
Order for Representation

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.G.G. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH RAMIRO SOTO. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
